meanings.definition: Tending to break or fall apart easily in small thin pieces.
meanings.sent1: The old book had flaky pages that crumbled at the touch.
meanings.sent2: The pastry was flaky and delicious, just like Grandma used to make.
meanings.sent3: I tried to write on the flaky paper, but it kept tearing like tissue paper.
meanings.sent4: The flaky paint on the fence peeled off like delicate petals in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The flaky snow on the ground sparkled in the sunlight like tiny diamonds.

meanings.definition: Unreliable or inconsistent in behavior or performance.
meanings.sent1: Her flaky friend always cancels plans at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The flaky internet connection made it impossible to finish the online test.
meanings.sent3: The flaky clock decided to stop working right before the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: His flaky memory caused him to forget his own birthday.
meanings.sent5: The flaky elevator would randomly stop on every floor, making everyone late.
